noun.description: A thing that someone says to cause amusement or laughter, especially a story with a funny punchline.
examples: she was in a mood to tell jokes

verb.description: Make jokes; talk humorously or flippantly.
examples: she could laugh and joke with her colleagues
“It's OK, we're not related,” she joked

phrases: trying to shop with three children in tow is no joke
Driving round York, particularly at rush hour, is no joke.
We were really shocked when we found out that it was no joke.
The parents exchanged glances; this was no joke.
I was reprimanded as she told me this was no joke.
origin: Late 17th century (originally slang): perhaps from Latin jocus jest, wordplay.
